ocpaccess.convert package¶

Submodules¶

ocpaccess.convert.convert module¶

ocpaccess.convert.convert.convert(in_file, out_file, in_fmt='', out_fmt='')[source]¶

Converts in_file to out_file, guessing datatype in the absence of in_fmt and out_fmt.

Arguments:
in_file: The name of the (existing) datafile to read out_file: The name of the file to create with converted data in_fmt: Optional. The format of incoming data, if not guessable out_fmt: Optional. The format of outgoing data, if not guessable
Returns:
String. Output filename
ocpaccess.convert.convert.hdf5_to_tiff(in_file, out_file)[source]¶
ocpaccess.convert.convert.tiff_to_hdf5(in_file, out_file)[source]¶

ocpaccess.convert.hdf5 module¶

ocpaccess.convert.hdf5.export_hdf5(hdf5_filename, numpy_data)[source]¶

Export a numpy array to a HDF5 file.

Arguments:
hdf5_filename: A filename to which to save the HDF5 data numpy_data: The numpy array to save to HDF5
Returns:
String. The expanded filename that now holds the HDF5 data
ocpaccess.convert.hdf5.import_hdf5(hdf5_filename)[source]¶

Import a HDF5 file into a numpy array.

Arguments:
hdf5_filename: A string filename of a HDF5 datafile
Returns:
A numpy array with data from the HDF5 file

ocpaccess.convert.tiff module¶

ocpaccess.convert.tiff.export_tiff(tiff_filename, numpy_data)[source]¶

Export a numpy array to a TIFF file.

Arguments:
tiff_filename: A filename to which to save the TIFF data numpy_data: The numpy array to save to TIFF
Returns:
String. The expanded filename that now holds the TIFF data
ocpaccess.convert.tiff.export_tiff_collection(tiff_filename_base, numpy_data, start_layers_at=1)[source]¶

Export a numpy array to a set of TIFF files, with each Z-index 2D array as its own 2D file.

Arguments:
tiff_filename_base: A filename template, such as “my-image-*.tiff”
which will lead to a collection of files named “my-image-0.tiff”, “my-image-1.tiff”, etc.

numpy_data: The numpy array data to save to TIFF.

Returns:
Array. A list of expanded filenames that hold TIFF data.
ocpaccess.convert.tiff.import_tiff(tiff_filename)[source]¶

Import a TIFF file into a numpy array.

Arguments:
tiff_filename: A string filename of a TIFF datafile
Returns:
A numpy array with data from the TIFF file
ocpaccess.convert.tiff.import_tiff_collection(tiff_filename_base)[source]¶

Import all files matching the filename base given via tiff_filename_base. Images are ordered by alphabetical order, which means that you MUST 0-pad your numbers if they span a power of ten (e.g. 0999-1000 or 09-10). This is handled automatically by the complement function, export_tiff_collection. Also, look at how nicely these documentation lines are all the same length!

Arguments:
tiff_filename_base: An asterisk-wildcard string that should refer
to all TIFFs in the stack. All * are replaced according to command-line expansion rules.
Returns:
A numpy array holding a 3D dataset
